overview: Kanau’Kyba means Paths of the Stones in our language Wapichana. We crossed different landscapes that connect the stones of the sky to the stones of the ancestral land. From the many walks on the land stones at Serra da Lua, in Roraima, in the Indigenous Land Canauanim, we got connected to the stones in Paraná, at the city of Kurityba. Field in flames. From the ashes at the National Museum at Rio de Janeiro and from the Bendegó stone to the borduna message: they will not erase our memory.
title: Kanau'kyba
